meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unnatural.
meanings.sent1: The unnaturalness of the situation made everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The unnaturalness of the colors in the painting stood out.
meanings.sent3: The party had an unnaturalness about it that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room had an unnaturalness that was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The unnaturalness of the fake flowers made them look almost real.

meanings.definition: Something that is not in accordance with nature or the normal course of events.
meanings.sent1: The sudden appearance of a unicorn was an unnaturalness in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The unnaturalness of the storm's intensity was alarming.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to meow like a dog had an unnaturalness that was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The unnaturalness of the situation was like a glitch in reality.
meanings.sent5: The unnaturalness of the glowing mushrooms made the forest seem magical.
